displayed_text:
Reported finding: With a daily aspirin, 57 rather than 61 people per 10,000 would be expected to suffer a heart attack or stroke; at the same time, 23 rather than 16 people per 10,000 would experience severe bleeding, on average.
Paper finding: In this meta-analysis of 13 trials enrolling 164 225 participants without cardiovascular disease, aspirin use was associated with reductions in the composite cardiovascular outcome consisting of cardiovascular mortality, nonfatal myocardial infarction, and nonfatal stroke.

displayed_text:
Reported finding: We further found that PC increased H2S production rate and CSE expressions, and protected young hearts from I/R-induced cardiomyocytes damage, all of which were disappeared in the aging hearts.
Paper finding: Taken together, our results indicated that aging rat hearts suffered from I/R injury and PC did not improve this injury.

displayed_text:
Reported finding: The nurse practice environment was the best predictor of poor-quality end-of-life care.
Paper finding: The best predictor of poor quality was the nurse practice environment.
